text: Ola Volo is a Kazakh Canadian artist,"Vancouver artist Ola Volo splashes stories upon walls" . The Georgia Straight, August 17, 2016. best known as a public muralist."Ola Volo : la muraliste qui a changé le visage du Mile End" . Voir, June 3, 2019. Her style blends aspects of Eastern European folk art with a focus on pattern and narrative to depict fantasy scenes."On Anthropomorphism & The Vague Dreams Of Ola Volo’s Childhood" . Scout Magazine, March 21, 2014. Born in Kazakhstan, she moved to Canada with her family at age 10, and studied art at Emily Carr University of Art and Design. Her work has included neighbourhood murals and corporate commissioned work in Vancouver, the Mackey Building in Sudbury as part of the 2016 Up Here Festival,"Virtual Up Here mural walk: Check out their murals year-round!" . Northern Life, August 15, 2018. and "Walla Volo" in Montreal's Mile End neighbourhood, the largest mural in Canada painted by a woman."Drone footage captures progress of historic new mural in Montreal" . Daily Hive, May 8, 2019. She designed the cover art for Matt Mays' album Once Upon a Hell of a Time,"CityFolk Preview: Matt Mays returns with new music" . Ottawa Citizen, September 13, 2017. and is the subject of the album's song "Ola Volo"."Matt Mays On World Cafe" . World Cafe, September 4, 2018. ==References== ==External links== * Category:21st-century Canadian painters Category:Canadian women painters Category:Canadian muralists Category:Canadian illustrators Category:Artists from Vancouver Category:Kazakhstani emigrants to Canada Category:Emily Carr University of Art and Design alumni Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Ola Volo
